title: Accrington Walks

images.title: Alexander P Kapp / Cannon Street, Accrington
images.caption: Cannon Street, Accrington

images.title: Richard Cliffe / Leeds/Liverpool Canal, Church, Accrington.
images.caption: Leeds/Liverpool Canal, Church, Accrington. View looking approx. North East, just 200 yards from the Changeline Bridge featuring the new mooring on the right and in the distance Clayton-Le-Moors on the left of the picture.

images.title: Alexander P Kapp / Leeds and Liverpool Canal, Oswaldtwistle
images.caption: Leeds and Liverpool Canal, Oswaldtwistle. The bridge carries the Blackburn to Accrington railway

images.title: Tom Howard / Eanam Wharf Blackburn
images.caption: Eanam Wharf Blackburn From the tow path of the Leeds and Liverpool canal looking towards Eanam Wharf. Three barges are moored at the wharf, beyond them Higher Eanam bridge crosses the canal serving the Blackburn to Accrington A677 road. The orange brick building on the right is named Prospect House, the home of Twin Valley Homes

description: This Lancashire based town has some nice canalside trails and a nature trail in nearby Woodnook. It's also close to the Ribble Valley and the West Pennine Moors where many of the walking highlights of the area can be found. This walk from the town takes you along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal to the neighbouring town of Blackburn. The walk starts at the train station and heads west towards Oswaldtwistle and Cote Holme. The route then picks up the canal towpath and follows it through Rishton where you will pass the Rishton Reservoir. You continue west through Whitebirk before coming into Blackburn and finishing at the cathedral in the town centre.
